150.summary: Las Vegas Raiders star edge rusher Maxx Crosby is already gelling with new head coach Pete Carroll, whose impact is being felt throughout the organization just weeks in.

151.title: Dem mayor unleashes task force in attempt to rescue crime-ridden city: 'Restore order to our streets'
151.summary: San Francisco Mayor David Lurie launched the San Francisco Police Department Hospitality Task Force as he works to clean up San Francisco's streets.

152.title: Boston lawyer found dead on houseboat as mystery woman faces murder charge
152.summary: Boston lawyer Joseph Donohue suffered stab wounds on a houseboat before Massachusetts authorities arrested suspect Nora Nelson in his murder.

153.title: Woman takes down US flag, replaces it with Mexican flag at California park: 'This is Mexican land'
153.summary: A woman allegedly took down an American flag at a California park and replaced it with a Mexican flag before threatening authorities.

154.title: President Trump says 'we will have relations with North Korea'; it's a 'big asset' that he gets along with Kim
154.summary: President Trump met with Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba at the White House and touted his good relationship with Kim Jong Un from meetings in his first term.

155.title: Matthew Stafford's wife sounds off on Rams amid speculation about quarterback's future, Cooper Kupp trade news
155.summary: Kelly Stafford, the wife of Los Angeles Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford, says their family is open to the idea of relocating amid offseason drama involving the veteran's future.

156.title: House Republicans continue Fani Willis investigation, requesting documents from DA employees
156.summary: House Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan and Rep. Barry Loudermilk sent Fulton County DA employees letters Thursday requesting documents in their possession related to the Jan. 6 Committee.

157.title: Top federal agency with history of wasteful spending could be next DOGE target
157.summary: Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) efforts appear ready to shift focus to the Social Security Administration, which is likely to spark criticisms from Democrats similar to those in response to DOGE's moves against the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID).

158.title: Mavericks GM getting boost in security for first home game since Luka Dončić trade after death threats: report
158.summary: Dallas Mavericks general manager Nico Harrison will reportedly have heightened security for the team's first home game after trading Luka Dončić and receiving death threats.

159.title: Science museum claims Legos push a 'heteronormative' agenda in LGBTQ tour
159.summary: Britain’s Science Museum has a “Seeing Things Queerly" tour that argued the way Legos are described as fitting together excludes the LGBTQIA+ community.

160.title: Jessica Alba, Cash Warren file for divorce after 16 years of marriage
160.summary: Actress Jessica Alba filed for divorce from her husband of 16 years, Cash Warren, on Friday.

161.title: Musk's next target? Trump says DOGE will look at Department of Education, Pentagon funding
161.summary: President Donald Trump said he has instructed Elon Musk to look into wasteful government spending at the Department of Education and the Pentagon.

162.title: Spinal cord stimulation restores movement for people with 'muscle wasting' disorder
162.summary: New research suggests that electrical spinal cord stimulation could improve muscle function for patients who have spinal muscle atrophy, even restoring the capability to walk.

163.title: Hall of Fame voter says Eli Manning discussion was one of 'most contentious' ever among committee
163.summary: Eli Manning will have to wait at least one more year to get into the Pro Football Hall of Fame after what was a "contentious" discussion to leave him out.

164.title: Brazil's socialist president tells citizens not to buy expensive grocery items as food prices rise
164.summary: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva said in a video message posted to social media that citizens should not buy expensive food items to deal with rising food prices.

165.title: Priest attacked during service in Washington Catholic church, says Holy Spirit helped him respond
165.summary: A priest is asking for prayers for a man who assaulted him earlier this week during a Washington church service.

166.title: Trump admin makes aggressive move to expand illegal immigrant detention: 'Outside the box'
166.summary: The Trump administration is now using federal prisons and jails to house illegal immigrants who have been arrested by ICE, the Bureau of Prisons confirms.

167.title: AOC tells followers to 'lock in' as Trump administration tries to 'flood the zone'
167.summary: Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez posted a lengthy video advising her followers on how to operate politically during Trump's new presidential term.

168.title: Bill Belichick's girlfriend clarifies jewelry drama, reveals dress motivation
168.summary: It was initially thought Bill Belichick's girlfriend wore one of his Super Bowl rings, but she revealed what she was actually wearing and the motivation behind her dress.

169.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Bryan Kohberger trial, Menendez brothers resentencing, Ellen Greenberg death
169.summary: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

170.title: CDC staff told to remove terms like 'non-binary,' 'they/them,' 'pregnant people' from public health material
170.summary: Researchers at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have been told to remove words frequently associated with progressive gender ideology from research manuscripts that they intend to publish.

171.title: Maxine Waters, House Dems ripped for 'unhinged' clash with security guard at Education Dept
171.summary: House Democrats were ripped on social media after trying to gain entry into the Department of Education building in Washington, D.C., and accosting a security guard while doing so.

172.title: Young girl with heart conditions denied being added to transplant list over vaccination status, family says
172.summary: A mother has spoken out after she said her 12-year-old adopted daughter was denied a spot on the heart transplant list because of her vaccination status.

173.title: Protests continue in Slovakia against PM Fico’s pro-Russia stance
173.summary: Large crowds call for Fico to resign after visit to Moscow.

174.title: As Trump’s anti-migrant push gains steam, advocates urge Canada to act
174.summary: Rights advocates say Canada, by upholding deal curbing asylum at US border, is 'complicit' in Trump's migrant crackdown.

175.title: Real Madrid vs Atletico Madrid: LaLiga – start, team news, how to follow
175.summary: A look at the Madrid derby as LaLiga leaders and defending champions Real host second-placed Atletico on Saturday.

176.title: Syrian whistleblower ‘Caesar’ reveals himself to Al Jazeera
176.summary: Syrian whistleblower “Caesar” has revealed his identity to the world in an exclusive interview with Al Jazeera.

177.title: Why is Trump pulling the plug on USAID?
177.summary: Thousands of employees have been placed on leave and aid recipients in more than 130 countries have been left in limbo.

178.title: Why has Trump hit the world criminal court with sanctions?
178.summary: Asset freezes, travel bans against International Criminal Court officials ordered in protest against Netanyahu warrant.

179.title: ‘Denying our truth’: Fighting residential school denialism in Canada
179.summary: Rejecting the full history of the institutions and the harms Indigenous children faced is a form of hate, survivors say.

180.title: World leaders react to Trump sanctions on International Criminal Court
180.summary: Countries condemn US sanctions on the ICC alleging impunity for serious crimes and weakening international law.

181.title: Man City name Ballon d’Or winner Rodri in squad for Champions League run in
181.summary: Manchester City include Rodri in their Champions League squad as hopes rise of return from injury this season.

182.title: Israeli army demolishes homes in Jenin, continues raids across West Bank
182.summary: Israeli forces demolish houses in Jenin refugee camp, local sources report, as assault continues for third week.

183.title: “Dehumanisation of Palestinians is so normalised,” Poet Mohammed El Kurd
183.summary: Marc Lamont Hill discusses the dehumanisation of Palestinians with author and poet Mohammed El-Kurd.

184.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events – day 1,079
184.summary: Here are the key developments on the 1,079th day of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

185.title: Hungary to ban pro-democracy groups, media outlets receiving US aid
185.summary: Under Orban, Hungary has for years enacted crackdowns on NGOs and the country’s independent media.

186.title: Frontline of Care
186.summary: People & Power explores the role of Lebanese citizens in the absence of the state.

187.title: US demands Hezbollah be omitted from Lebanon government
187.summary: Deputy Middle East Envoy Morgan Ortagus says armed group has been defeated and is no longer a threat.

188.title: UN warns against regional spread of DR Congo conflict
188.summary: 'Worst may be yet to come' says UN human rights chief as DRC and Rwanda deny responsibility and blame one another.

189.title: Thousands of Palestinians flee Israeli raids in the occupied West Bank
189.summary: Israeli raids have pushed thousands of Palestinians from their homes in the occupied West Bank.

190.title: Fact check: Did Clinton set the precedent for mass federal worker buyouts?
190.summary: In early 1990s, Clinton signed an act allowing $25,000 buyouts for federal workers. How does Trump's approach differ?

191.title: China slams US as Panama quits Belt and Road Initiative
191.summary: Amid pressure from the US, Panama is first Latin American country to leave Beijing's global infrastructure club.

192.title: Canelo Alvarez drops Jake Paul fight to sign Saudi Arabia deal
192.summary: Mexican boxer Canelo Alvarez has dropped plans to fight Jake Paul by signing with Riyadh Season in Saudi Arabia.

193.title: Iran dismisses talks with US as it blasts new sanctions
193.summary: Iran said the US sanctions will prevent it from conducting legitimate trade with partners.

194.title: Elon Musk is a global problem
194.summary: The far-right billionaire seems to be trying to replicate all across the world what he already has achieved in the US.

195.title: As Greece declares ’emergency’ over Santorini earthquakes, what’s next?
195.summary: The island has been experiencing near-constant tremors since late January, with thousands of earthquakes recorded.

196.title: Trump’s foul solution to the Palestinian ‘problem’ was aided by Biden, too
196.summary: The US president finally said out loud what his predecessors always tried to hide behind more agreeable language.

197.title: How Grand Theft Auto is helping Nigerians survive rampant police abuse
197.summary: 'Cops and robbers'-type online gameplay is helping young people re-enact and process real-life challenges with police.

198.title: Trump says Musk will review "just about" every federal agency
198.summary: In a press conference with the Japanese prime minister, President Trump indicated Elon Musk has wide latitude to review nearly every federal agency.

199.title: U.N.'s ICC condemns Trump's sanctions, calls for global support
199.summary: The International Criminal Court, sanctioned by Trump after issuing an arrest warrant for Israel's leader, calls on all nations "to stand united for justice."

200.title: 2/5: CBS Evening News
200.summary: USAID worker says "everyone is really scared" at agency after being locked out; Hubble Telescope captures cosmic collision from 50 million years ago

201.title: Family mourns Sweden shooting victim who called fiancée to say goodbye
201.summary: Badly wounded, Salim Karim Iskef managed to video-call his fiancée to say he loved her one last time before he died in Sweden's deadliest mass shooting.

202.title: Palestinians reject President Trump's plan for Gaza as Marco Rubio prepares to visit region
202.summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio plans to travel to the Middle East next week after backlash against President Trump's plan for the U.S. to "take over" and rebuild Gaza. Israel's government is preparing to move Palestinians out of the territory, but Gazans say they're not leaving.

203.title: China fumes at U.S. as Panama pulls out of key agreement with Beijing
203.summary: Panama's decision to leave a key investment deal with China has drawn accusations from Beijing of "pressure and coercion" by the Trump administration.

204.title: Russian spy ship catches fire, issues warning: "Please hear me"
204.summary: The audio provides an unusual peek inside Russia's fleet of spy ships that NATO nations are watching closely.

205.title: France plans $800M makeover for the Louvre, Mona Lisa's overcrowded home
205.summary: Paris' centuries-old Louvre Museum — home of da Vinci's iconic Mona Lisa — is getting an $800 million makeover, and American visitors will have to help pay for it.

206.title: Panama's president rejects U.S. claim of a deal for free canal passage
206.summary: Panama's president says the State Department's claim of an agreement granting U.S. warships free canal passage was "based on a falsity. And that's intolerable."

207.title: USAID shutdown ripples worldwide: "Huge impact on actual human lives"
207.summary: Grassroots groups around the world have lost funding for a range of humanitarian projects, including medical aid and fighting human trafficking.

208.title: "Narco sub" loaded with 5,000 pounds of cocaine seized off Colombian coast
208.summary: Officials said a total of 111 bundles were found, containing 2,276 kilograms of cocaine with a street value of about $76 million.

209.title: Head of NGO coalition says U.S. foreign aid freeze has been "devastating"
209.summary: InterAction CEO Tom Hart sits down with Margaret Brennan to discuss the impact of the pause on foreign assistance. InterAction is a coalition of about 170 NGOs.

210.title: U.S. service member, 3 defense contractors killed in plane crash
210.summary: Officials are investigating after a small plane crash in the Philippines left four dead.

211.title: 102 venomous snakes found in homeowner's backyard in Australia
211.summary: An animal rescue service in Australia expected to remove four red-bellied snakes from the backyard of a Sydney home. Instead, they uncovered more than 100.

212.title: Fury in India over U.S. deportees allegedly being leg-chained on flight
212.summary: Indian lawmakers have voiced rage over the U.S. allegedly flying dozens of deportees halfway around the world in handcuffs and leg chains.

213.title: U.K. firm finds way to turn damaging greenhouse gas into useful products
213.summary: Methane is one of the climate-damaging gases emitted by industry, but a British firm has found a way to give it a major makeover.

214.title: What Rubio told U.S. diplomats about the future of foreign aid, as most programs paused
214.summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told U.S. diplomats behind closed doors about how foreign aid will be distributed by the Trump administration.

215.title: Giving methane a makeover
215.summary: Methane is one of the most harmful greenhouse gases emitted by industries around the world, but as Tina Kraus reports, a company in England has found a way to turn the climate change culprit into not just one, but two incredibly useful products.

216.title: How shuttering USAID could impact famine, lives in Sudan
216.summary: President Trump's efforts to shutter the humanitarian agency, USAID, could have drastic impacts on places like war-torn Sudan. The stoppage could mean less medicine for the sick, fewer first responders and more famine. Warning, the images in this story are graphic.

217.title: Palestinians and Israelis respond to President Trump's Gaza plans
217.summary: Palestinians and Israelis are reacting to President Trump's proposal for the U.S. to develop the Gaza Strip amid Israel's ceasefire with Hamas. While some, like Israel's defense minister, have praised Trump's proposal, many oppose the idea. CBS News' Chris Livesay has more.

218.title: Mona Lisa will have its own room after Louvre renovation, but it will cost more to see
218.summary: The renovation at the Louvre Museum in Paris will see the famed Mona Lisa moved to its own, separate space, where it will be easier to manage the crowds. However, visitors will have to purchase an extra ticket to see the work of art.

219.title: Investigation targets online groups accused of child sex abuse, torture
219.summary: Two men have been arrested for their roles in what authorities called "extremist" online communities.

220.title: Cocaine "no worse than whiskey," Colombia's president says
220.summary: Cocaine "is no worse than whiskey" and is only illegal because it comes from Latin America, said Colombian President Gustavo Petro, whose nation is the world's biggest cocaine producer and exporter.

221.title: One of Europe's most-wanted fugitives spotted at religious service
221.summary: Jos Leijdekkers — also known as "Omar Sheriff" and "Chubby Jos" — is accused of trafficking cocaine and ordering a murder.

222.title: Aid workers warn Trump's aid freeze could hit Sudan's starving children
222.summary: Sudan's civil war is starving millions of civilians, who rely largely on foreign aid that has come from the U.S. more than anywhere else.

223.title: January 2025 was hottest January on record despite factors working against it
223.summary: The world set yet another monthly heat record in January, despite an abnormally chilly U.S., a cooling La Nina​​ and predictions of a slightly less hot 2025, the European climate service Copernicus says.

224.title: Scientists say they've produced world's first IVF kangaroo embryo
224.summary: Australia-based scientists say they've produced the world's first kangaroo embryo through IVF and hailed it as a key step toward saving endangered marsupials.

225.title: Trump's comments on Gaza draw backlash as Palestinians return home after ceasefire
225.summary: President Trump drew backlash when he suggested the United States should take control of the Gaza Strip and move Palestinians out during a news conference with the Israeli prime minister at the White House. Chris Livesay reports that Mr. Trump is floating the idea as many Palestinians return home under the ceasefire deal.

226.title: Trump's aid freeze will worsen Sudan famine and cost lives, workers say
226.summary: Some of the humanitarian aid USAID provided went to the African nation of Sudan. For two years now, its people have been caught in the middle of a civil war between two warlords. Debora Patta got a rare look inside the country.

227.title: USAID worker says "everyone is really scared" at agency after being locked out
227.summary: USAID personnel have been locked out of their offices and email since Monday, leaving many confused as to whether they'll have healthcare or paychecks coming. One staffer spoke anonymously to Margaret Brennan, calling the shakeup by the Trump administration a "moral atrocity."

228.title: UN warns of regional escalation in DR Congo conflict ahead of the high stakes Tanzania summit
228.summary: Diplomatic efforts to achieve peace are getting underway this weekend in Tanzania. It will be the first time that Paul Kagame and Felix Tshisekedi engage in direct talks since the resurgence of the conflict. As the United Nations warned of regional escalation, the Congelese President hopes to get out of the summit an immediate ceasefire and the unconditional withdrawal of M23 group and its Rwandan allies, but it is not clear if Kigali is willing to make those concessions.
228.author: Yinka OYETADE

229.title: Israel and Hamas to seal fifth prisoner-hostage exchange Saturday
229.summary: Hamas named three more Israeli hostages it plans to release Saturday in exchange for 183 Palestinian prisoners in the fifth hostage-prisoner exchange between the militants and Israel. The latest swap takes place amid the global outcry sparked by US President Donald Trump's proposal for a US takeover of Gaza, remarks which certain mediators fear could derail the fragile ceasefire agreement.
229.author: NEWS WIRES

230.title: Brussels grapples with spree of shootings linked to drug gangs
230.summary: Brussels is grappling with an outbreak of drug-related violence with authorities appearing powerless to stem a rise in violent crime connected to a thriving narcotics trade. Footage went viral of masked men firing automatic weapons outside a Brussels metro station on Wednesday while commuters ran for their lives.
230.author: NEWS WIRES

231.title: North Korean soldiers back on Russia's front line, says Zelensky
231.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that North Korean soldiers "have been brought in again" to Russia's Kursk region after reports that the troops had been pulled from the front due to high casualties. Zelensky added that a "significant number" of opposing troops had been "destroyed".
231.author: NEWS WIRES

232.title: Trump 'floods the zone', France's 'Monsieur Confidence', UK plays the 'Grey Man'
232.summary: This week, Donald Trump’s latest bombshell—suggesting the U.S. should own Gaza and relocate its population in what he calls a Real Estate solution. Critics call it ethnic cleansing; he calls it Gaza Lago. Meanwhile, Keir Starmer kept a low profile at his first EU summit as Trump threatened tariffs on the bloc. And over in France, François Bayrou has clung to power after yet another no-confidence vote.
232.author: Gavin LEE

233.title: Haute Couture collections, summer 2025: Antidotes to tense times
233.summary: In 2025's uncertain climate and amid international crises, luxury industries are questioning their model: how to meet ever more ambitious financial targets? How can creativity inspire people to dream? Solutions are offered up by feminist designer Maria Grazia Chiuri’s take on Alice and her wonderland, while irresistible Dutch duo Viktor & Rolf make fun of AI and the sparkling Japanese couturier Yuima Nakazato has an outfit that we'll be able to wear for 10,000 years.
233.author: Pascal MOURIER

234.title: Enrico Letta to Europe: 'Now is the time to act'
234.summary: Forty years after Europe's Single Market was conceived as the cornerstone of post-war integration for millions of citizens across its member states, a divided continent is in danger of behind left behind in a fierce global competition dominated by the United States and China, Italy’s former prime minister, Enrico Letta, told FRANCE 24.
234.author: Douglas HERBERT

235.title: 'France can be a bit bolder': Paris AI summit draft declaration sparks concern for civil society
235.summary: A draft declaration of the Paris AI Action Summit has raised concerns for The Future Society, the nonprofit which was tasked by organisers to provide recommendations for protecting civil society from the risks of artificial intelligence.
235.author: Peter O'BRIEN

236.title: Locked out of decent housing, disabled residents in France struggle for dignity
236.summary: For people with disabilities in France, finding accessible housing is particularly challenging. From emergency shelters unfit for mobility needs to social housing failing wheelchair users, the housing crisis hits disabled residents hardest and pushes many to the brink, as revealed in a new report by the Foundation for Housing the Disadvantaged.
236.author: Lara BULLENS

237.title: Economy, migration, defence loom large in German election: A turning point for Europe?
237.summary: Of all the elections happening in the EU this year, the vote in Germany is probably the one that is being watched most closely across the bloc. Europe's largest economy is in trouble; the old model of cheap gas and easily accessible export markets is no longer working. Meanwhile, its political fragmentation makes it increasingly hard for Germany to re-define its role in Europe, whether that's on defence spending, climate and energy policies or competitiveness. In this debate we explore what is stake for Europe, and how the outcome of the February 23 election could impact the conversation on defence, immigration and other key issues.
237.author: Armen GEORGIAN

238.title: 🔴 Follow live: Hamas releases names of three Gaza hostages to be freed Saturday
238.author: FRANCE24

239.title: Former French president Sarkozy to get electronic tag after being convicted of graft
239.summary: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy is to be fitted with en electronic tag for a year after being found guilty of corruption, a source close to the case said on Friday. Sarkozy will wear the ankle monitor from February 7 and will only be allowed out of his home at certain times, the source added.
239.author: NEWS WIRES

240.title: UN Human Rights Council launches probe into abuses in eastern DR Congo
240.summary: The UN's top human rights body on Friday launched an investigation into alleged abuses during the escalating crisis in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DR Congo) and adopted a resolution urging Rwanda-backed M23 soldiers to retreat immediately from occupied territory.
240.author: FRANCE 24

241.title: Israel and Hamas set for next hostage-prisoner exchange
241.summary: Israel and Hamas are due to exchange more hostages and prisoners Saturday, but the backlash over President Donald Trump's proposal for a US Gaza takeover has cast doubt over the fragile truce's future. Gazans and Israelis are now waiting to see if this weekend's swap goes according to plan and whether talks on the second phase of the ceasefire deal can move on in Doha.
241.author: FRANCE24

242.title: Medical care for Myanmar refugees paralysed as Trump shutters USAID
242.summary: US President Donald Trump's decision to freeze foreign aid programmes and effectively shut down USAID – the US government agency responsible for international development – has rattled countries across Asia. In Thailand, home to some 90,000 refugees from Myanmar, medical care for the displaced people has already been paralysed.
242.author: Yuka ROYER

243.title: Paris prosecutors open probe into Musk's X over alleged algorithmic distortions
243.summary: Prosecutors in Paris launched an investigation into Elon Musk's X social media for alleged algorithmic distortions, Franceino reported on Friday, citing the prosecutor's office. The probe was opened after a centrist French MP reported on January 12 that X was using biased algortihms.
243.author: NEWS WIRES

244.title: Confronting a surge in femicides in Kenya
244.summary: The brutal murder of Olympic runner Rebecca Cheptegei in September 2024 brought renewed global attention to a silent epidemic in Kenya: femicide and other forms of violence against women. With nearly 100 women murdered by men in just three months, 2024 was one of the deadliest years on record for Kenyan women. With mentalities slow to change and in the absence of a meaningful response from the government, some Kenyan women are taking matters into their own hands by enrolling in self-defence classes. And while William Ruto's government unveiled a 42-member task force to address gender-based violence in January, feminist activists are already voicing concerns it will do little make a significant impact. Erin Ogunkeye spoke to feminist and security professor Awino Okech of SOAS University of London for more. She's also the director of the Feminist Centre for Racial Justice.
244.author: Erin OGUNKEYE

245.title: AI and the arts: A new cultural frontier
245.summary: In this show we're reflecting on the rise of the machines, as AI-generated arts are becoming a mainstay of the cultural landscape. As Paris hosts the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit, we ask: what does its prevalence mean for creativity, for the cultural industries and for the artists who might be replaced by machines?
245.author: Olivia SALAZAR-WINSPEAR

246.title: 'Incredibly dangerous, immensely destabilising for displacement of Palestinians into Egypt, Jordan'
246.summary: Palestinians in Gaza say they are determined to rebuild their own seafront restaurants and hotels, dismissing U.S. President Donald Trump's vision of creating a "Riviera of the Middle East" emptied of its population and under U.S. control. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, FRANCE 24's William Hilderbrandt welcomes Dr H. A. Hellyer, Scholar in the Middle East Program at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace in Washington DC, specialising in Security Studies. Dr. Hellyer is also Senior Associate Fellow at the Royal United Services Institute (RUSI) for Defence and Security Studies in London where he is based.
246.author: FRANCE24

247.title: 'Exile is exile': Displaced Lebanese voice lingering fears of war
247.summary: Displaced people in Lebanon are voicing their trauma and lingering fears of the recent war between Israel and Hezbollah. Despite the ongoing ceasefire, which came into effect late last year, many of the one million displaced Lebanese are still unable to return home.
247.author: FRANCE24

248.title: Trump administration moves to shutdown US govt aid agency
248.summary: The Trump administration plans to reduce the number of staff at the US government's giant humanitarian agency USAID to fewer than 300 people from more than 10,000, the New York Times reported Thursday. The move is part of a radical drive by Trump and his billionaire ally Elon Musk to shrink the US government.
248.author: FRANCE24

249.title: Artificial intelligence and the future of journalism
249.summary: Most newsrooms have a mix of excitement and concern over artificial intelligence. The technology is racing so fast that many outlets are struggling to keep up, much less establish thoughtful charters on how to implement AI into their workflow. This week's guest on FRANCE 24's media show Scoop is Phil Chetwynd, the global news director at the French news agency AFP. He discusses the challenges ahead and talks about AFP's new partnership with Mistral AI.
249.author: William HILDERBRANDT

250.title: Generative AI models are known to amplify prejudice – can they be fixed?
250.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) tools are known to reproduce and amplify human prejudice about race or gender, but correcting such discriminatory bias has proved challenging. US President Donald Trump’s return to power appears to have nipped in the bud any hopes of progress – unless Europe can stand up to the deregulatory wave.
250.author: Bahar MAKOOI

251.title: UN aid chief warns of 'risk of ethnic cleansing' over Trump's Gaza plan
251.summary: FRANCE 24 spoke to Tom Fletcher, the United Nations Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs. He reacted to US President Donald Trump's controversial plan for the US to take over Gaza and to displace the Palestinian population to neighbouring countries. "There has been real concern across the humanitarian community about the risk of ethnic cleansing," Fletcher said. Asked about the Trump administration suspending foreign aid, he warned that "we've got to find new supporters" to fund a $47 billion global shortfall in humanitarian aid.
251.author: Marc PERELMAN

252.title: Kash Patel was paid by Russian filmmaker with Kremlin ties, documents show
252.summary: Patel, Trump’s nominee to be FBI director, was paid $25,000 last year by a film company that has promoted anti-Western views advanced by the Kremlin, documents show.
252.author: Greg Miller, Jon Swaine, Catherine Belton, Mark Berman, Derek Hawkins

253.title: Sweden to tighten gun laws, restrict AR-15-style rifles, after mass shooting
253.summary: Sweden is set to tighten its gun laws, including a ban on certain semiautomatic weapons, after a mass shooting that left 11 people dead.
253.author: Adam Taylor

254.title: How countries around the world have responded to mass shootings
254.summary: In the United States, mass shootings are on the rise. But in many countries, they are rare — and lead to drastic change when they occur.
254.author: Adam Taylor, Amanda Coletta, Jennifer Hassan

255.title: Trump’s proposal to displace Gazans may impede efforts with Saudi Arabia
255.summary: Middle East analysts say Trump’s comments have complicated his drive to secure diplomatic ties between Saudi Arabia and Israel.
255.author: Susannah George, Shira Rubin

256.title: What is the International Criminal Court, on which Trump placed sanctions?
256.summary: Trump has ordered sanctions on the ICC, which wields power to prosecute individuals accused of genocide, crimes against humanity, crimes of aggression and war crimes.
256.author: Sammy Westfall, Sarah Dadouch, Jacqueline Alemany

257.title: Independent media in Russia, Ukraine lose their funding with USAID freeze
257.summary: Independent media in Russia and Ukraine have been critical of their governments and provide alternative reporting, but much of it relied on U.S. grants.
257.author: David   Stern, Robyn Dixon

258.title: Recall of USAID’s global workforce causes havoc and distress
258.summary: USAID employees stationed overseas are struggling to navigate the sudden upheaval, having received little clear information from the Trump administration.
258.author: Missy Ryan, Katharine Houreld, John Hudson

259.title: Brazilian plane crashes into traffic, engulfing bus in flames and killing 2
259.summary: A small plane crashed into a busy street in São Paulo, killing two people on board and injuring several others.
259.author: Terrence McCoy

260.title: As Ukraine struggles to field soldiers, recruitment centers are attacked
260.summary: Kyiv insists the attacks are orchestrated by Russia, but there is rising reluctance in the country to join the fight as the war drags on.
260.author: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Kostiantyn Khudov

261.title: Trump signs order imposing sanctions on International Criminal Court
261.summary: The order accused the ICC of illegitimately asserting jurisdiction and abusing its power.
261.author: Maegan Vazquez, Jacqueline Alemany

262.title: For Chinese exporters big and small, a week of chaos and confusion
262.summary: The Trump administration’s tariffs and restrictions on Chinese imports are already hurting businesses making everything from plush toys to fast fashion.
262.author: Katrina Northrop, Lyric Li

263.title: Japan’s Ishiba will try to sell Trump on importance of alliances in Asia

301.title: The fight for a legendary shipwreck's treasure
301.summary:
The San Jose was a marvel of 17th century technology. The Spanish galleon weighed more than a thousand tons, was made of wood reinforced with iron, and featured three masts and 64 cannons. In its cargo were gold, silver, silk and porcelain. But in 1708, it sank after a battle with an English ship near what is now Colombia.

For centuries, the shipwreck was the stuff of legends, until 2015 when underwater investigators found what they believed to be the San Jose's wreckage. The treasure on board this ship could be worth billions of dollars. But who owns it? Today on the show, four groups stake their claims to the wreck of the San Jose. Those claims reveal a lot about who has a say over the bottom of the sea and how we can begin to untangle the complicated legacy of colonialism.

This episode of Planet Money was hosted by Erika Beras and Mary Childs. It was produced by Sam Yellowhorse Kesler with reporting help from Willa Rubin and edited by Keith Romer. It was fact-checked by Sierra Juarez and engineered by Neil Rauch with help from Robert Rodriguez. Alex Goldmark is Planet Money's executive producer.

Help support Planet Money and hear our bonus episodes by subscribing to Planet Money+ in Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org/planetmoney.

388.summary: Draped in Mexican and Salvadoran flags, roughly 1,000 demonstrators gathered near City Hall shortly before noon, blocking traffic at Spring and Temple streets.
388.author: Daniel Miller, Ben Poston

389.title: Column: A president who won't tell the truth about California may unfairly punish the state
389.summary: Trump's bogus claims about his popularity in the Golden State could be laughed off if he hadn't threatened tying wildfire relief to an overhaul of the state's election system. It's both reckless and cruel.
389.author: Mark Z. Barabak

390.title: Trump cuts chaotic path in first weeks, bucking laws and norms in pursuit of promised agenda
390.summary: President Trump in his first weeks back in the White House repeatedly bucked the Constitution in pursuit of his conservative agenda. Democrats decried the ensuing "chaos."
390.author: Kevin Rector

391.title: Mexico and Canada order retaliatory tariffs on U.S. after Trump starts trade war
391.summary: President Trump announced sweeping tariffs on goods imported from Mexico, Canada and China, triggering a trade war and raising fears about consumer costs.
391.author: Kate Linthicum, Don Lee

392.title: This French film about Mexico has 13 Oscar nominations. Why 'Emilia Pérez' is tanking in Mexico
392.summary: Although it's set in Mexico City, French film 'Emilia Pérez' ran into a frost reception on its opening there. Critics cited stereotypes and the lack of a clear message about the narcos it portrays.
392.author: Patrick J. McDonnell, Cecilia Sánchez Vidal

393.title: Trump and the L.A. fires have made for nonstop news. Experts share ways to deal, not reel
393.summary: Experts said many people today feel overwhelmed by the news, but there are ways to reduce such anxiety, in part by reducing scrolling.
393.author: Kevin Rector

394.title: CDC scrubs research databases referencing sexual orientation and gender identity
394.summary: Health researchers began sharing warnings on social media several days ago, urging members of the community to make copies of federal data before the information was removed from the CDC website.
394.author: Corinne Purtill, Karen Kaplan

395.title: Rubio carries anti-immigration message to Latin America in first trip overseas as Trump's top diplomat
395.summary: Rubio has to balance aggressive Trump policies with Latin America's willingness to cooperate. The Panama Canal will be contentious.
395.author: Tracy Wilkinson

396.title: Another unwelcome consequence of climate change: an explosion of urban rats
396.summary: Global warming is worsening droughts, making sea levels rise, and fueling deadly storms. Now scientists have a new problem to add to that list: Climate change is helping rat populations thrive in U.S. cities.
396.author: Karen Kaplan

397.title: Trump's order on antisemitism and 'Hamas sympathizers' has California universities on alert
397.summary: Trump's executive order calling on campuses to address antisemitism has university leaders, faculty and students concerned as the president vows to revoke visas of pro-Palestinian international students who have taken part in protests.
397.author: Jaweed Kaleem

398.title: A fragile Gaza cease-fire holds for now, as Hamas frees eight more hostages
398.summary: Eight hostages held by Hamas militants are returned to Israel as Palestinian prisoner releases proceed — but can the Gaza cease-fire hold?
398.author: Laura King

399.title: Trump's orders have upended U.S. immigration. What legal routes remain?
399.summary: President Trump, in his first days in office, has released a series of executive orders that will reshape the country's immigration system. We lay out the key changes.
399.author: Jessica Garrison, Rebecca Plevin

400.title: As Trump cuts federal jobs, even national parks are on the chopping block
400.summary: As the Trump administration rushes to eliminate federal jobs, even the national parks — among the country's most beloved and least politicized institutions — are in the crosshairs.
400.author: Jack Dolan

401.title: A new Syrian government struggles to reset its corrupt, besieged economy
401.summary: With Syria's corruption-ridden economy in shambles after the overthrow of Bashar Assad, the caretaker government's priority is to raise cash and bring stability.
401.author: Nabih Bulos

402.title: These House newcomers came to the Capitol with big plans. Then the wildfires hit
402.summary: The California infernos were baptism by fire in Washington politics for Reps. Luz Rivas, George Whitesides and Laura Friedman.
402.author: Faith E. Pinho

403.title: Senators challenge Robert Kennedy Jr. on vaccines in confirmation hearing as health secretary
403.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced aggressive questions about his skepticism of vaccines and other issues during the first of two scheduled Senate confirmation hearings.
403.author: Seema Mehta, Karen Kaplan

404.title: Is Trump pushing his presidential powers beyond what the Constitution allows?
404.summary: Trump is likely to succeed in expanding presidential powers on some fronts because the Constitution generally puts vast power in the hands of the president.
404.author: David G. Savage

405.title: There's a new royal baby in town: Britain's Princess Beatrice welcomes second child early
405.summary: Princess Beatrice, who is ninth in line to the British throne, has welcomed her second child with her husband, millionaire property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi.
405.author: Nardine Saad

406.title: Column: No one polices men's bodies the way we police women's bodies
406.summary: As President Trump takes a hammer to reproductive rights, a Mississippi legislator proposes making it illegal to ejaculate without the 'intent to fertilize an embryo.'
406.author: Robin Abcarian

407.title: Column: Trump pardoned a lot of bad apples. Now he and Republicans own the barrelful
407.summary: Republicans have long styled themselves as the party of law and order and 'backing the blue,' but Trump freed people who attacked police. How does that make the country safer?
407.author: Mark Z. Barabak

408.title: Immigration arrests in churches? Some clergy say not so fast
408.summary: Churches took in refugees from battle-scarred Central America in the 1980s, a precursor to their current focus on undocumented immigrants.
408.author: Andrea Castillo

409.title: Chinese films dodging censors have no place to go. Can they crack into Taiwan?
409.summary: Taiwan is an ideal place for Chinese filmmakers to evade censorship. But the island democracy has its own restrictions on what Chinese films are allowed to air.
409.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

410.title: Low math and English scores mark the nation's report card, California and L.A. included
410.summary: Scores nationwide and in California have yet to rebound from pandemic-era declines. Some outcomes continue to get worse. Low math and English scores, California and L.A. included, mark the nation's report card.
410.author: Howard Blume

411.title: Will Mexico accept military flights of deportees? President Sheinbaum deflects on sensitive issue
411.summary: The Trump administration's use of U.S. military aircraft to return deportees has raised alarms throughout Latin America.
411.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

412.title: Federal judge blocks White House freeze on 'financial assistance' amid anger, confusion
412.summary: California will help lead a coalition of states in suing to block a White House budget office order halting "all federal financial assistance."
412.author: Kevin Rector, Faith E. Pinho, Emily Alpert Reyes

413.title: Goldberg: President Trump demands GOP unity. Here's why he might not get it
413.summary: Trump has left the Republican faithful scrambling to explain and defend his actions beyond blind cult-of-personality loyalty. With the slim GOP majorities in Congress, that's not politically manageable
413.author: Jonah Goldberg

414.title: Former Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff will split time between L.A. and New York in new legal job
414.summary: Questions about former Vice President Kamala Harris' plans have swirled since she lost her presidential bid — notably about whether the former California senator and attorney general will run for governor next year.
414.author: Seema Mehta

415.title: Justice Dept. halts legal programs for detained immigrants, cuts off advocates' access to facilities
415.summary: The suspension of advocates' access to immigrant detention centers eliminates most chances for detainees without a lawyer to receive basic legal information.
415.author: Rachel Uranga

416.title: With diminished clout, Californians in Congress struggle to counter Trump's agenda
416.summary: With little power in Republican-led Washington, D.C., California Democrats struggle to mount a countereffort to President Trump's agenda.
416.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

417.title: Thousands of Palestinians stream back to northern Gaza as cease-fire with Israel holds
417.summary: Israeli troops pull back but maintain a watchful eye on the tens of thousands of Gazans who had been displaced during the 15 months of fighting.
417.author: Nabih Bulos

418.title: As Colombia ends its immigration standoff with Trump, Mexico looks eager to avoid a clash
418.summary: Colombia attempted to stand up to Trump's immigration demands, with mixed results. Mexico appears to be playing it safer.
418.author: Kate Linthicum, Tracy Wilkinson

419.title: Calmes: Trump's focus on retribution distracts from the nation's real domestic enemies
419.summary: The new president's enemies aren't America's enemies. If the FBI turns to retribution, what will protect us from the real threats that endanger the nation?
419.author: Jackie Calmes

420.title: Trump and Biden add to long, strange history of presidential pardons
420.summary: Trump's clemency for Jan. 6 rioters and Biden's reprieve for family represent merely the latest chapters in an odd history of the presidential pardon.
420.author: David Wharton

421.title: Is Xavier Becerra's next move running for governor? He's not saying. Yet.
421.summary: Former President Biden's secretary of Health and Human Services is strongly considering running for governor of California, according to allies.
421.author: Seema Mehta

422.title: Trump punishes Colombia for refusing entry to deportation flights
422.summary: He slaps a 25% tariff on Colombian goods and imposes a raft of visa restrictions. Latin American nations are grappling with how to deal with Trump on his signature issue.
422.author: Tracy Wilkinson

423.title: Column: The rise of Silicon Valley, from indifference to lords of the political universe
423.summary: The assembly of billionaires at Trump's inauguration was a display of wealth and power unlike any before. The display was all the more remarkable given how recently many in tech were politically naive or apathetic.
423.author: Mark Z. Barabak

424.title: Trump talks 'free speech' while moving to muzzle those he disagrees with
424.summary: President Trump issued an executive order purporting to end government censorship. Critics scoffed, saying his actions do just the opposite.
424.author: Kevin Rector

425.title: California's growing need for caregivers could collide with a crackdown on immigrants
425.summary: The Trump administration's plans to crack down on immigration and launch mass deportations could drain caregivers from the workforce as California and the country face the needs of an aging population, advocates and experts say.
425.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

426.title: Abcarian: Does Donald Trump's return to power mean it's time to admit he's right? In a word, no
426.summary: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde's plea to Trump the day after his inauguration exemplified the principled criticism the president deserves regardless of his victory.
426.author: Robin Abcarian

427.title: Opinion: Trump promised to end the Ukraine war, but neither side is ready
427.summary: As Eisenhower once said of how conflicts end, 'sometimes it just gets down to the dirty job of killing until one side or the other cracks.'
427.author: ML Cavanaugh

428.title: Stranded in Mexico City, these migrants hoping to reach the United States have no good options
428.summary: The 1,500 migrants living in this Mexico City encampment face hard choices with President Trump in office.
428.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

429.title: Community groups set up strike teams to respond to Trump's mass deportation plans
429.summary: Community groups are dusting off the rapid-response networks they built during President Trump's first administration to prepare for immigration sweeps in California's agricultural heartland.
429.author: Rebecca Plevin

430.title: Visiting L.A. after firestorm, Trump focuses on overhauling California water policy
430.summary: President Trump says he plans to issue an order to 'open up the pumps' and deliver more water from the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta to California farms and cities.
430.author: Ian James

431.title: Supreme Court will decide if religious schools may be funded as public charters
431.summary: The Supreme Court agreed to hear a new church-state case that could yield a potentially momentous decision and change the funding of public schools in much of the nation.
431.author: David G. Savage

432.title: Trump revokes the security detail of Dr. Anthony Fauci, who has faced death threats
432.summary: Trump revoked the security for Dr. Anthony Fauci, the infectious disease expert and former advisor turned critic who faces regular threats to his life.
432.author: Associated Press and Times staff

433.title: Cease-fire in Gaza Strip was widely welcomed. It may not last. Here's why
433.summary: Powerful forces in Middle East and, now, in Washington working against truce lasting beyond its first phase.
433.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King

434.title: Opinion: It's now clear that America's death penalty is dying one generation at a time
434.summary: Capital punishment has continued to become rarer in recent years, and public opinion of the practice keeps growing dimmer with time.
434.author: Austin Sarat

435.title: Meet the first couples to wed as Thailand legalizes same-sex marriage
435.summary: Thailand has long been known as a haven for LGBTQ+ communities. It is only the third place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage, behind Taiwan in 2019 and Nepal in 2023.
435.author: Stephanie Yang

436.title: Trump's rebuke to 'gender ideology' changes federal policy and sets up clash with California
436.summary: The executive order conflicts with laws in California and other blue states that forbid discrimination based on gender identity. The courts are expected to take up the issue.
436.author: David G. Savage

437.title: Under Trump, we could be flying blind when it comes to bird flu, other infectious diseases
437.summary: President Trump announced he's pulling the U.S. from the WHO. Now researchers are scrambling to understand what that means for the H5N1 bird flu pandemic.
437.author: Susanne Rust

438.title: Alawites wary as a post-Assad Syria takes shape
438.summary: Once Syria's most influential minority, Alawites struggle to move on from their association with a hated dictator.
438.author: Nabih Bulos

439.title: U.S. and Australia have long fought fires together. Climate change threatens joint efforts
439.summary: U.S. officials didn't even bother to ask Australia for help battling the Los Angeles fires.
439.author: Max Kim, Maria Petrakis

440.title: Less process than 'a traffic ticket': ACLU sues to stop Trump's fast-track deportation policy
440.summary: ACLU sues to stop Trump policy that allows immediate deportation of some immigrants. The new policy could pave the way for mass expulsions.
440.author: Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga

441.title: 'Scare tactic': Bonta slams Trump move targeting local officials over immigration
441.summary: The Department of Justice is planning to investigate and possibly prosecute state and local officials who hinder Trump administration immigration efforts.
441.author: Faith E. Pinho, Keri Blakinger, Ruben Vives

442.title: Calmes: President Trump's Jan. 6 pardons broke his promise to the nation
442.summary: The new/old president seems to have a memory issue. 'You will pay,' he told Jan. 6 lawbreakers in 2021. You're free to go, he said Monday.
442.author: Jackie Calmes

443.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
443.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
443.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

444.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
444.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
444.author: Seema Mehta

445.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
445.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington. Many condemn the gestures, but not the ADL.
445.author: Kevin Rector

446.title: What did Trump's team learn from past legal battles? Immigrant advocates prepare to find out
446.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
446.author: Andrea Castillo

447.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
447.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
447.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

448.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
448.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
448.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

449.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
449.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
449.author: Robin Abcarian

450.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
450.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
450.author: Kevin Rector

451.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
451.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
451.author: Seema Mehta

452.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
452.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
452.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

453.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
453.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
453.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

454.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
454.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
454.author: Lila Seidman

455.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
455.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
455.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

456.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
456.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
456.author: Doyle McManus

457.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
457.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
457.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

458.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
458.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
458.author: Kevin Rector

459.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
459.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
459.author: Seema Mehta

460.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
460.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
460.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

461.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
461.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
461.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

462.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
462.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
462.author: A.T. McWilliams

463.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
463.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
463.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

464.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
464.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
464.author: Karen Kaplan

465.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
465.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
465.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

466.title: Trump directs Elon Musk to review defense and education spending
466.summary: President Trump directed Elon Musk to scrutinize spending in the US Department of Defense and Education as part of a federal government efficiency initiative. Musk's team is investigating various departments to identify waste, fraud, and abuse. Trump praised Musk's efforts so far and indicated ongoing evaluations.
466.author: TOI World Desk

467.title: 'Elon is allowed but not us': Ruckus at education department office as Democrat Congressmen were denied entry
467.summary: A confrontation occurred outside the department of education as Democrat members of Congress were blocked from entering the office by security. The lawmakers, led by Rep. Mark Takano, sought to meet Secretary Denise Carter to discuss President Trump's anticipated executive order to dismantle the agency. But the security said they needed to have an appointment.
467.author: TOI World Desk

468.title: US Transportation Secretary Duffy expresses willingness to allow Musk to restructure air traffic control
468.summary: U.S. aviation authorities are considering allowing Elon Musk to modernize the air traffic control system within a year. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy supports the initiative despite concerns from some Democrats about Musk's lack of expertise in aviation. Musk's team, known for rapid innovations, aims to enhance system efficiency significantly.
468.author: TOI World Desk

469.title: Donald Trump reacts to Time Magazine's 'President Musk' cover: 'They're still in business?'
469.summary: Time Magazine's Person of the Year 2024, President Donald Trump expressed shock that the Time Magazine is still in the business when he was asked to comment of the new cover of the magazine that illustrated Elon Musk as the president, sitting behind the Resolute Desk. CNN described the cover as a provocative one aimed at irking President Trump.
469.author: TOI World Desk

470.title: JD Vance says he disagrees with Elon Musk's 'India-hating' DOGE staff but...
470.summary: Marko Elez, a 25-year-old staffer from Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency, resigned following revelations of past racist social media posts. JD Vance voiced support for reinstating Elez, while Elon Musk criticized Wall Street Journal journalist Katherine Long calling her cruel and disgusting. Musk conducted a poll showing substantial support for Elez's return.
470.author: TOI World Desk

471.title: 'I love Hitler': Kanye West accuses Elon Musk of stealing his 'Nazi swag'
471.summary: Kanye West faces backlash for his recent antisemitic posts praising Hitler and accusing Elon Musk of Nazi appropriation. Despite prior apologies, West's return to hate speech has drawn widespread criticism, highlighting ongoing concerns about his conduct on social media.
471.author: TOI World Desk

472.title: Super Bowl reporter found dead in New Orleans hotel; woman with history of drugging men arrested in chilling twist
472.summary: Danette Colbert, a 48-year-old woman, was arrested for the death of Kansas City Telemundo reporter Adan Manzano in New Orleans. She has a history of drugging men and stealing credit cards. Manzano was found dead in his hotel room, and toxicology tests are being conducted. Colbert is charged with fraud and theft, and the investigation is ongoing.
472.author: TOI World Desk

473.title: Kamala Harris, husband Doug spotted at Lakers game; haters say 'nobody even cared'
473.summary: Former Vice President Kamala Harris and her husband Doug Emhoff attended a Los Angeles Lakers game Thursday. In a viral video, Kamala Harris was seen waving at which haters took a swipe asking whom were they waving. "Kamala Harris is at the Lakers vs. Warriors basketball game right now, and no one there even cares. Who exactly is she waving at?" one wrote on X.
473.author: TOI World Desk

474.title: 'It looks like a stream of blood.' A river near Buenos Aires turns red, sparking fears of toxic leak
474.summary: A stream near Buenos Aires turned blood-red, sparking fears of industrial chemical dumping. Residents shared shocking images, linking the phenomenon to nearby tanneries. Officials suspect aniline, a toxic dye chemical, and have launched an investigation. Locals report the stream has changed colors before and have long complained about pollution. Authorities are now examining water samples to determine the cause and potential health risks.

475.title: Elon Musk clarifies he's straight though he loves Donald Trump, social media wonders what happened
475.summary: Elon Musk made a strange post on X quantifying how much he loves President Donald Trump after Trump Friday called for shutting down USAID. "I love@realDonaldTrump as much as a straight man can love another man," Elon Musk posted. Musk also called Trump the 'greatest president ever' as Trump said he would bring back plastic straws.
475.author: TOI World Desk

476.title: 'Back to plastic': Donald Trump to bring back plastic straws
476.summary: President Trump opposes President Biden's environmentally-friendly paper straw initiative, announcing plans to bring back plastic straws via an executive order. The move aligns with Trump's previous environmental policies, including withdrawal from the Paris climate accord. He has consistently criticized paper straws for their ineffectiveness.
476.author: TOI World Desk

477.title: 'Close it down': Trump calls for closure of USAID, says 'corruption is at levels rarely seen before'
477.summary: President Trump has called for the closure of USAID, declaring widespread corruption within the agency. Supported by Elon Musk, the administration aims to reduce government institutions, significantly slashing USAID’s workforce and halting international aid. Congressional Democrats contest Trump's authority to eliminate agencies without approval, citing constitutional concerns.
477.author: TOI World Desk

478.title: Judge in Boston to consider latest bid to block Trump's birthright citizenship order
478.summary: A federal judge in Boston will hear a case from 18 state attorneys general seeking to block President Donald Trump’s executive order ending birthright citizenship for children of undocumented parents. Similar rulings in Seattle and Maryland have already paused the order. The lawsuit argues the order violates the 14th Amendment, which has upheld birthright citizenship since 1868. The Trump administration contends noncitizen children aren't entitled to citizenship.

479.title: Boston attorney stabbed to death on his houseboat, duct-taped in blanket; dog's body floating in water
479.summary: Boston lawyer Joseph Donohue, 65, was brutally murdered on his houseboat, suffering multiple stab wounds. Police discovered his duct-taped, weighted body, with a knife blade lodged in his skull, and one of his dogs drowned. Nora Nelson, 24, was arrested on unrelated warrants. Despite her arrest, many questions about the crime remain unanswered.
479.author: TOI World Desk

480.title: Hawk Tuah girl Hailey Welch breaks down on podcast responding to her 'crypto scam'
480.summary: In the latest podcast, she can be seen getting emotional over the episode and how she should not have trusted the "friend of a friend" who is to be blamed for the entire incident, she said. “I probably should have looked into him a little bit more,” Welch said adding that the idea was brought to her as a "long-term coun" that "would change the way everybody thinks about crypto".
480.author: TOI World Desk

481.title: Who is Kshama Sawant, Indian-American protesting at Indian Consulate over visa rejection
481.summary: Kshama Sawant, an Indian-origin American politician, led a demonstration after being denied an emergency visa to visit her ailing mother in Bengaluru. The Indian consulate in Seattle described the demonstration as 'unauthorised entry,' while Sawant alleged physical assault by officials. She has faced previous visa rejections and attributes them to anti-India advocacy efforts.
481.author: TOI News Desk

482.title: New Time Magazine cover shows Elon Musk behind Resolute Desk as President
482.summary: Elon Musk appears on the Time Magazine cover as 'President Musk' in an illustration done by the magazine as he and his Department of Government Efficiency gain strength in the administration. The cover story noted that no man before Elon Musk wielded such authority in the government and these are just the beginnings, it said.
482.author: TOI World Desk

483.title: Cyprus court jails Syrian over death of migrant girl
483.summary: A Cypriot court sentenced a Syrian man who captained a migrant boat from Lebanon to three years in prison over causing the death of a young girl from dehydration, authorities said Friday. A statement by the Cypriot prosecution service said the Famagusta criminal court sentenced the Syrian national, 47, on Thursday after finding him guilty of negligence resulting in the death of a three-year-old Syrian girl, who died from dehydration.

484.title: Russia claims it's taken another eastern Ukraine town. Kyiv officials make no comment
484.summary: Russia's defense ministry claimed on Friday that its forces had captured Toretsk, a key mining town in Ukraine’s Donetsk region, as part of its ongoing eastern offensive. Ukraine has not yet confirmed the claim. Russia’s sustained attacks have gradually weakened Ukrainian defenses, with Moscow using heavy artillery and glide bombs to advance. The capture, if confirmed, would mark another step in Russia’s push to dominate the Donbas industrial region.

485.title: Boston University staff calls for 'murder' of DOGE employees; Elon Musk reacts
485.summary: Jared May was listed online as an assistant media technician at Boston University which apparently removed May's staff page. The university did not issue any statement on the post but a university representative told Boston.com that it was his personal view and not the varsity's. "He has committed a crime," Elon Musk wrote in a post.
485.author: TOI World Desk

486.title: Hungary moves to expose USAID funding
486.summary:
Prime Minister Viktor Orban has announced plans to disclose foreign funding to organizations that undermine his government
Read Full Article at RT.com
486.author: RT

487.title: Former Polish PM accuses Ukrainians of arson attacks
487.summary:
Ukrainian agents could be behind recent wave of fires that have hit Poland, according to the country’s former Prime Minister Leszek Miller
Read Full Article at RT.com
487.author: RT

488.title: Trump says he ‘will probably’ meet Zelensky next week
488.summary:
The US president has also expressed hope he will hold talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin in the coming days, too
Read Full Article at RT.com
488.author: RT

489.title: UK demands Apple allow spying on users worldwide – WaPo
489.summary:
The British government has reportedly issued a notice compelling Apple to create a backdoor to its encrypted iCloud service
Read Full Article at RT.com

706.title: Online Education: A Lifeline for Afghan Girls Amid Taliban Restrictions
706.summary:
Feb 07 (IPS) - Since the Taliban regained power in Afghanistan in 2021, girls and women have been systematically banned from education, making Afghanistan the only country in the world that denies schooling to girls over the age of 12. The situation continues to deteriorate, with even primary school enrollment for girls in decline, according to UNESCO.

Read the full story, “Online Education: A Lifeline for Afghan Girls Amid Taliban Restrictions”, on globalissues.org →

707.title: Belarus: A Sham Election That Fools No One
707.summary:
LONDON, Feb 07 (IPS) - Alexander Lukashenko will soon begin his seventh term as president of Belarus. The official result of the 26 January election gave him 86.8 per cent of the vote, following an election held in a climate of fear. Only token opposition candidates were allowed, most of who came out in support of Lukashenko. Anyone who might have offered a credible challenge is in jail or in exile.

Read the full story, “Belarus: A Sham Election That Fools No One”, on globalissues.org →

708.title: WFP, FAO Warn of the Severity of the Climate Crisis and Food Insecurity
708.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Feb 07 (IPS) - Over the past few years, climate shocks have become more frequent and have devastated economies and agriculture systems, exacerbating widespread malnutrition and hunger. It has become increasingly apparent that the utilization of sustainable agriculture practices and disaster risk management systems are crucial to fulfill growing needs as natural resources continue to dwindle.

Read the full story, “WFP, FAO Warn of the Severity of the Climate Crisis and Food Insecurity”, on globalissues.org →

710.title: Tanzanians with HIV Left in Crisis as USAID Funding Ends
710.summary:
DAR ES SALAAM, Feb 07 (IPS) - At 9 a.m. on Monday, Mariam Msemwa clutched her clinic card tightly as she stood in line at Bagamoyo District Hospital’s HIV Clinic in Tanzania’s coastal region. The 19-year-old had been here many times before, picking up monthly doses of antiretroviral (ARV) drugs that kept her alive. But today was different. When she reached the counter, the nurse flatly told her. “There’s no more free medication, ” she said. “You’ll have to buy it yourself.”

Read the full story, “Tanzanians with HIV Left in Crisis as USAID Funding Ends”, on globalissues.org →
